title: How to delete a retweet on 'New' Twitter - Quora

response.answer_text: If you mean how can you delete something you've retweeted, click the Retweet button a second time. You will no longer have retweeted it. If you want to delete a tweet of yours that someone else has retweeted, you can delete the original post by going to that person's page, and clicking delete when you scroll to the right of the post, or deleting that tweet directly from your own timeline. You cannot delete someone else's RT of your post, though.

To undo a retweet on “New” Twitter, steps you need to do are: find the tweet you have retweeted in your profileclick the “Retweet”icon, and then choose “Undo Retweet” optionThis method is commonly used by everyone, and it works well.  Another quick and time-saving method is to use Twitter management tool, with it, you can undo all the retweets you have forwarded in one click. You can even filter the retweets that will be undone by some conditions. Such as, the published time of the tweet, the number of retweets and likers of the tweet, the number of hashtag existed in the tweet, whether the retweet is a reply, and more. Settings of undo a retweet on the tool are as follows:  In addition, you can also use the whitelist function to add tweets from users that you do not want to unretweet. This way the tool will only undo the tweets of those people you don’t want to share.
